activities.loc: Parties to appear remotely via Zoom (SC-2095)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth J Kowalski

defendant.name: Kowalski, Kenneth J
defendant.address: W248 N2172 Kettle Cove Court, Pewaukee, WI 53072

records.addlTxt:
9:07 AM Defendant Kenneth J Kowalski appeared by video. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that PTO contemplates a dismissal upon completion of up-front community service. However, no confirmation has been provided to the State of completion of community service. 

Court will set matter over for further proceeding for defendant to speak to the State.
State will route file to charging DA. 
Defendant may appear by zoom for next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Letter filed by Defendant requesting to adjourn the Hearing set for 10/10/2022, filed with other documents

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/6/2022 - Okay to reschedule. Zoom approved for next appearance only.**

8:43 AM Defendant Kenneth J Kowalski appeared by video. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 

Court advises of right to an attorney. 
State advises there is an offer, but is unsure if he received it. No discovery has been provided as no discovery demand has been made. 
Defendant has received the pre-trial offer, and stated that he sent a letter with a counter offer. 
State asks that the Defendant call the DA's office to confirm that they have received his counter offer letter. 
Court will sent another further proceeding. 
Court will allow the Defendant to appear by zoom for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Letter from defendant to the Court requesting to appear via Zoom for the next hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/22/2022 - Granted.**

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to sign bond with the Criminal and Traffic Division within 5 business days, if not signed a warrant will be issued.

01:02 PM Defendant Kenneth J Kowalski in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth J Kowalski appeared by video means.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 18, 2022.

Filed by defendant-request to appear by zoom.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 07-11-2022. Granted.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Reviewed by Judge Schimel - Request for adjournment of the initial appearance granted. ep

Letter from defendant requesting adjournment.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 06-28-2022. "Denied. Due to Marsy's law and victim notification, and the lateness to which this request is received, the court will deny the request for an adjournment. The court will however allow for Defendant to appear by way of Zoom. Please confirm receipt of Complaint."
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on June 7th, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
